turns.raw_header: You used the tag `!<q>` before your message. I don’t have built‑in knowledge of that specific syntax as a standard command, but I can treat it as:
turns.body:
- A possible marker that this is a “quoted” or “quick” message, or  
- A custom prefix from another tool or environment you’re using.

Your content after the tag is simply:

> test

If you’re experimenting: I’m receiving your messages normally; the `!<q>` doesn’t change how I process the text unless you tell me what behavior you want it to trigger.
turns.footer: If you’d like, tell me what `!<q>` is supposed to mean in your setup, and I can adapt (for example: treat it as “answer briefly,” “treat as a quote,” etc.).

parsed_footer.raw: If you’d like, tell me what `!<q>` is supposed to mean in your setup, and I can adapt (for example: treat it as “answer briefly,” “treat as a quote,” etc.).

turns.body:
Like `!<q>`, this isn’t a standard control code I recognize, so I’m just treating it as a prefix and focusing on the text:

> second test

I’m receiving everything correctly.
turns.footer: If `!<o>` is meant to signal a specific style or mode (e.g., “outline,” “objective,” “output only”), tell me what you intend it to do and I’ll follow that convention.
